## • <a name="ml_function_create">`ml function create`</a>
Create a new function with the given payload. A function is some code that can be deployed as an online, or batch deployment.

```sh
cpdctl ml function create [command options]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--model-references` ([`ModelReference[]`](#cli-model-reference-example-schema))
:   This is a list of references of the models that are used by this function, if any. These references are provided by the owner of the function and are used for usage tracking only.

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--sample-scoring-input` ([`SyncScoringData`](#cli-sync-scoring-data-example-schema))
:   Scoring data.

`--sample-scoring-input-input-data` ([`InputDataArray[]`](#cli-input-data-array-example-schema))
:   The input data.

`--schemas` ([`FunctionEntitySchemas`](#cli-function-entity-schemas-example-schema))
:   The schemas of the expected data.

`--schemas-input` ([`DataSchema[]`](#cli-data-schema-example-schema))
:   The schema of the expected input data.

`--schemas-output` ([`DataSchema[]`](#cli-data-schema-example-schema))
:   The schema of the expected output data.

`--software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--software-spec-id` (string)
:   The id of the software specification. One, and only one, of 'id' or 'name' must be set.

`--software-spec-name` (string)
:   The name of the software specification. One, and only one, of 'id' or 'name' must be set.

`--software-spec-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the software specification.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

`--type` (string)
:   Type of the function to be created. Only 'python' type is supported as of now. If not specified, 'python' is the default. Functions expect a gzip file that contains a python file that make up the function. Python functions specify what needs to be run when the function is deployed and what needs to be run when the scoring function is called. In other words, you are able to customize what preparation WML does in the environment when you deploy the function, as well as what steps WML takes to generate the output when you call the API later on. The function consists of the outer function (any place that is not within the score function) and the inner score function. The code that sits in the outer function runs when the function is deployed, and the environment is then frozen and ready to be used whenever the online scoring or batch inline job processing API is called. The code that sits in the inner score function runs when the online scoring or batch inline job processing API is called, in the environment customized by the outer function. See [Deploying Python function](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/ml-deploy-py-function.html?context=cpdaas&audience=wdp) for more details.

This is illustrated in the example below:

>&lt;python code used to set up the environment&gt; \
>\
>def score(payload): \
>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;df_payload = pd.DataFrame(payload["values"]) \
>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;df_payload.columns = payload["fields"] \
>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;... \
>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;output = {"result" : res} \
>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;return output \
>\
>return score.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml function create \
    --name my-resource \
    --software-spec '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "..."}' \
    --project-id 12ac4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --space-id 3fc54cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --description 'This is my first resource.' \
    --tags t1,t2 \
    --type python \
    --sample-scoring-input '{"input_data": [{"id": "exampleString", "fields": ["name","age","occupation"], "values": [["exampleString","anotherTestString"],["exampleString","anotherTestString"]]}]}' \
    --schemas '{"input": [{"id": "t1", "name": "Tasks", "fields": [{"anyKey": "anyValue"},{"anotherAnyKey": "anotherAnyValue"}], "type": "struct"}], "output": [{"id": "t1", "name": "Tasks", "fields": [{"anyKey": "anyValue"},{"anotherAnyKey": "anotherAnyValue"}], "type": "struct"}]}' \
    --custom '{"anyKey": "anyValue"}' \
    --model-references '[{"space_id": "3fc54cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f", "project_id": "12ac4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f", "id": "exampleString", "rev": "exampleString"}]' \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

:   The revision number of the resource.

:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml function download-code \
    --function-id 64dc8921-345f-234b-462d-78e41246987f \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --rev 2 \
    --version 2019-01-01 \
    --output-file tempdir/example-output.txt
```
## • <a name="ml_function_get">`ml function get`</a>
Retrieve the function with the specified identifier. If `rev` query parameter is provided,
`rev=latest` will fetch the latest revision. A call with `rev={revision_number}` will fetch the given revision_number record. Either `space_id` or `project_id` has to be provided and is mandatory.

```sh
cpdctl ml function get --function-id FUNCTION-ID [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--rev REV]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--function-id` (string)
:   Function identifier.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--rev` (string)
:   The revision number of the resource.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml function get \
    --function-id 64dc8921-345f-234b-462d-78e41246987f \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --rev 2 \
    --version 2019-01-01
```
## • <a name="ml_function_list">`ml function list`</a>
Retrieve the functions for the specified space or project.

```sh
cpdctl ml function list [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--start START] [--limit LIMIT] [--tag-value TAG-VALUE] [--search SEARCH]
```

#### Command options

`--all-pages` (bool)
:   Invoke multiple requests to display all pages of the collection for function-list.

    The default value is `false`.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--limit` (int64)
:   How many resources should be returned. By default limit is 100. Max limit allowed is 200.

    The default value is `0`.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--search` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this search string. The path to the field must be the complete path to the field, and this field must be one of the indexed fields for this resource type. Note that the search string must be URL encoded.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--start` (string)
:   Token required for token-based pagination. This token cannot be determined by end user. It is generated by the service and it is set in the href available in the 'next' field.

`--tag-value` (string)
:   Return only the resources with the given tag values, separated by 'or' or 'and' to support multiple tags.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml function list \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --start exampleString \
    --limit 50 \
    --tag-value 'tf2.0 or tf2.1' \
    --search exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

## • <a name="ml_function_update">`ml function update`</a>
Update the function with the provided patch data. The following fields can be patched:
- `/tags`
- `/name`
- `/description`
- `/custom`.

```sh
cpdctl ml function update --function-id FUNCTION-ID [--json-patch JSON-PATCH | @JSON-PATCH-FILE] [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--function-id` (string)
:   Function identifier.

`--json-patch` ([`JSONPatchOperation[]`](#cli-json-patch-operation-example-schema))
:   Input For Patch. This is the patch body which corresponds to the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Patch standard (RFC 6902).

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml function update \
    --tags t1,t2 \
    --name my-resource \
    --description 'This is my first resource.' \
    --custom '{"anyKey": "anyValue"}' \
    --version 2019-01-01
```
## • <a name="ml_function_upload-code">`ml function upload-code`</a>
Upload the function code. Functions expect a zip file that contains a python file     that make up the function. Python functions specify what needs to be run when     the function is deployed and what needs to be run when the scoring function is     called. In other words, you are able to customize what preparation WML does in     the environment when you deploy the function, as well as what steps WML takes to     generate the output when you call the API later on. The function consists of the     outer function (any place that is not within the score function) and the inner     score function. The code that sits in the outer function runs when the function     is deployed, and the environment is then frozen and ready to be used whenever     the online scoring or batch inline job processing API is called. The code that     sits in the inner score function runs when the online scoring or batch inline     job processing API is called, in the environment customized by the outer function.     See [Deploying Python function](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/ml-deploy-py-function.html?context=cpdaas${content_description}audience=wdp) for more details.         This is illustrated in the example below:        <pre> <br />     ...python code used to set up the environment... <br />     <br />     def score(payload): <br />         df_payload = pd.DataFrame(payload[values]) <br />         df_payload.columns = payload[fields] <br />         ... <br />         output = {result : res} <br />         return output <br />     <br />     return score <br />     </pre>.

```sh
cpdctl ml function upload-code --function-id FUNCTION-ID --upload-code UPLOAD-CODE [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--function-id` (string)
:   Function identifier.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--upload-code` (io.ReadCloser)
:   A gzip file containing code files.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml function upload-code \
    --function-id 64dc8921-345f-234b-462d-78e41246987f \
    --upload-code tempdir/test-file.txt \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --version 2019-01-01
```
## • <a name="ml_model_create">`ml model create`</a>
Create a new model with the given payload. A model represents a machine learning model asset. If a `202` status is returned then the model will be ready when the
`content_import_state` in the model status (/ml/v4/models/{model_id}) is `completed`. If `content_import_state` is not used then a `201` status is returned.

```sh
cpdctl ml model create [command options]
```

#### Command options

`--async` (bool)
:   Run the command asynchronously. By default it waits for the processing to finish.

    The default value is `false`.

`--content-location` ([`ContentLocation`](#cli-content-location-example-schema))
:   Details about the attachments that should be uploaded with this model.

`--content-location-connection` (map[string]string)
:   Connection properties.

`--content-location-contents` ([`ContentInfo[]`](#cli-content-info-example-schema))
:   The content information to be uploaded.

`--content-location-location` (map[string]string)
:   Location properties.

`--content-location-type` (string)
:   The data source type like 'connection_asset' or 'data_asset'. Allowable values are: connection_asset, data_asset, url, fs.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--data-preprocessing` ([`DataPreprocessingTransformation[]`](#cli-data-preprocessing-transformation-example-schema))
:   Array which contains the data preprocessing transformations.

Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--domain` (string)
:   User provided domain name for this model. For example: sentiment, entity, visual-recognition, finance, retail, real estate etc.

`--hybrid-pipeline-software-specs` ([`SoftwareSpecRel[]`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   The list of the software specifications that are used by the pipeline that generated this model, if the model was generated by a pipeline.

`--hyper-parameters` (generic map)
:   Hyper parameters used for training this model.

`--label-column` (string)
:   The name of the label column.

`--metrics` ([`Metric[]`](#cli-metric-example-schema))
:   Metrics that can be returned by an operation.

`--model-definition` ([`ModelDefinitionID`](#cli-model-definition-id-example-schema))
:   The model definition.

`--model-definition-id` (string)
:   The id of the model definition.

`--model-version` ([`ModelEntityModelVersion`](#cli-model-entity-model-version-example-schema))
:   Optional metadata that can be used to provide information
about this model that can be tracked with IBM AI Factsheets.
See [Using AI Factsheets](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/factsheets-model-inventory.html) for more details.

`--model-version-description` (string)
:   This is the user provided description that provides context for the change in the model version.

Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'.

`--model-version-number` (string)
:   This is the user-provided version which should follow semantic versioning.

`--model-version-tag` (string)
:   This is the user-provided tag for the model.

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--pipeline` ([`Rel`](#cli-rel-example-schema))
:   A reference to a resource.

`--pipeline-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--pipeline-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--schemas` ([`ModelEntitySchemas`](#cli-model-entity-schemas-example-schema))
:   If the prediction schemas are provided here then they take precedent over any schemas
provided in the data references. Note that data references contain the schema for the
associated data and this object contains the schema(s) for the associated prediction, if any.
In the case that the prediction input data matches exactly the schema of the training data
references then the prediction schema can be omitted. However it is highly recommended to
always specify the prediction schemas using this field.

`--schemas-input` ([`DataSchema[]`](#cli-data-schema-example-schema))
:   The schema of the expected prediction input data, see
[datarecord-metadata-v2-schema](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/elyra-ai/pipeline-schemas/master/common-pipeline/datarecord-metadata/datarecord-metadata-v2-schema.json) for the schema definition.

`--schemas-output` ([`DataSchema[]`](#cli-data-schema-example-schema))
:   The schema of the expected prediction output data, see
[datarecord-metadata-v2-schema](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/elyra-ai/pipeline-schemas/master/common-pipeline/datarecord-metadata/datarecord-metadata-v2-schema.json) for the schema definition.

`--size` ([`ModelEntitySize`](#cli-model-entity-size-example-schema))
:   This will be used by scoring to record the size of the model.

`--size-content` (float64)
:   The size of the model on disk.

    The default value is `0`.

`--size-in-memory` (float64)
:   The memory size of the model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--software-spec-id` (string)
:   The id of the software specification. One, and only one, of 'id' or 'name' must be set.

`--software-spec-name` (string)
:   The name of the software specification. One, and only one, of 'id' or 'name' must be set.

`--software-spec-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the software specification.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

`--test-data-references` ([`DataConnectionReference[]`](#cli-data-connection-reference-example-schema))
:   The holdout/test datasets.

`--training-data-references` ([`DataConnectionReference[]`](#cli-data-connection-reference-example-schema))
:   The training data that was used to create this model.

`--training-id` (string)
:   Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'. This field can be used to store the 'id' of the training job that was used to produce this model.

`--transformed-label-column` (string)
:   The name of the  label column seen by the estimator, which may have been transformed by the previous transformers in the pipeline. This is not necessarily the same column as the 'label_column' in the initial data set.

`--type` (string)
:   The model type. The supported model types can be found in the documentation
[here](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/wmls/wmls-deploy-python-types.html?context=analytics).

`--user-defined-objects` (map[string]string)
:   User defined objects referenced by the model. For any user defined class or function used in the model, its name, as referenced in the model, must be specified as the 'key' and its fully qualified class or function name must be specified as the 'value'. This is applicable for 'Tensorflow 2.X' models serialized in 'H5' format using the 'tf.keras' API.

## • <a name="ml_model_create-revision">`ml model create-revision`</a>
Create a new model revision. The current metadata and content for model_id will be taken and a new revision created. Either `space_id` or `project_id` has to be provided and is mandatory.

```sh
cpdctl ml model create-revision --model-id MODEL-ID [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--commit-message COMMIT-MESSAGE]
```

#### Command options

`--commit-message` (string)
:   An optional commit message for the revision.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--model-id` (string)
:   Model identifier.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model create-revision \
    --model-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --space-id 3fc54cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 12ac4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --commit-message exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

## • <a name="ml_model_download-content">`ml model download-content`</a>

```sh
cpdctl ml model download-content --model-id MODEL-ID --attachment-id ATTACHMENT-ID [--accept ACCEPT] [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--rev REV]
```

#### Command options

`--accept` (string)
:   The type of the response: application/zip, application/gzip, application/json, text/plain, or application/xml. A character encoding can be specified by including a 'charset' parameter. For example, 'text/plain;charset=utf-8'.

:   Identifier for the attachment for resources that support separate content.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--model-id` (string)
:   Model identifier.

`--output-file` (string)
:   Filename/path to write the resulting output to.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--rev` (string)
:   The revision number of the resource.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model download-content \
    --model-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --attachment-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --accept application/zip \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --rev 2 \
```

## • <a name="ml_model_filtered-download">`ml model filtered-download`</a>
Download the model content identified by the provided criteria. If more than one attachment is found for the given filter then a
`400` error is returned. If there are no attachments that match the filter then a `404` error is returned. If there are no filters then, if there is a single attachment, the attachment content will be returned otherwise a `400` or `404` error will be returned as described above. This method is just a shortcut for getting the attachment metadata and then downloading by attachment id. This command is supported starting with release 3.5 of Cloud Pak for Data.

```sh
cpdctl ml model filtered-download --model-id MODEL-ID [--accept ACCEPT] [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--rev REV] [--pipeline-node-id PIPELINE-NODE-ID] [--deployment-id DEPLOYMENT-ID] [--name NAME] [--content-format CONTENT-FORMAT]
```

#### Command options

`--accept` (string)
:   The type of the response: application/zip, application/gzip, application/json, text/plain, or application/xml. A character encoding can be specified by including a 'charset' parameter. For example, 'text/plain;charset=utf-8'.

`--content-format` (string)
:   This is the format of the content. Any value can be used for the format and is there to be able to easily find content by format.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--deployment-id` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this 'deployment_id', this is only relevant if 'content_format' is 'coreml'.

`--model-id` (string)
:   Model identifier.

`--name` (string)
:   Match an attachment with this name.

`--output-file` (string)
:   Filename/path to write the resulting output to.

`--pipeline-node-id` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this 'pipeline_node_id', this is only relevant if 'content_format' is 'pipeline-node'.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--rev` (string)
:   The revision number of the resource.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model filtered-download \
    --model-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --accept application/zip \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --rev 2 \
    --pipeline-node-id 62344cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814aacd \
    --deployment-id 62344cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814aacd \
    --name my_model \
    --content-format native \
    --version 2019-01-01 \
    --output-file tempdir/example-output.txt
```

## • <a name="ml_model_list">`ml model list`</a>
Retrieve the models for the specified space or project.

```sh
cpdctl ml model list [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--start START] [--limit LIMIT] [--tag-value TAG-VALUE] [--search SEARCH]
```

#### Command options

`--all-pages` (bool)
:   Invoke multiple requests to display all pages of the collection for model-list.

    The default value is `false`.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--limit` (int64)
:   How many resources should be returned. By default limit is 100. Max limit allowed is 200.

    The default value is `0`.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--search` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this search string. The path to the field must be the complete path to the field, and this field must be one of the indexed fields for this resource type. Note that the search string must be URL encoded.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--start` (string)
:   Token required for token-based pagination. This token cannot be determined by end user. It is generated by the service and it is set in the href available in the 'next' field.

`--tag-value` (string)
:   Return only the resources with the given tag values, separated by 'or' or 'and' to support multiple tags.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model list \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --start exampleString \
    --limit 50 \
    --tag-value 'tf2.0 or tf2.1' \
    --search exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

- `/name`
- `/description`
- `/custom`
- `/software_spec` (operation 'replace' only).

```sh
cpdctl ml model update --model-id MODEL-ID [--json-patch JSON-PATCH | @JSON-PATCH-FILE] [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}]
```

:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--json-patch` ([`JSONPatchOperation[]`](#cli-json-patch-operation-example-schema))
:   Input For Patch. This is the patch body which corresponds to the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Patch standard (RFC 6902).

`--model-id` (string)
:   Model identifier.

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model update \
    --tags t1,t2 \
    --name my-resource \
    --description 'This is my first resource.' \
    --custom '{"anyKey": "anyValue"}' \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--package-version` (string)
:   Required. The package version.

`--platform` ([`ModelDefinitionEntityRequestPlatform`](#cli-model-definition-entity-request-platform-example-schema))
:   null It can also be a path to a JSON file.

`--platform-name` (string)
:   The name of the platform.

`--platform-versions` (string)
:   The supported versions.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--software-spec-id` (string)
:   The id of the software specification. One, and only one, of 'id' or 'name' must be set.

`--software-spec-name` (string)
:   The name of the software specification. One, and only one, of 'id' or 'name' must be set.

`--software-spec-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the software specification.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model-definition create \
    --name my-resource \
    --package-version exampleString \
    --platform '{"name": "exampleString", "versions": ["exampleString","anotherTestString"]}' \
    --project-id 12ac4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --space-id 3fc54cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --description 'This is my first resource.' \
    --tags t1,t2 \
    --command exampleString \
    --software-spec '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "..."}' \
```

## • <a name="ml_model-definition_list">`ml model-definition list`</a>
Retrieve the model definitions for the specified space or project. This command is supported starting with release 3.5 of Cloud Pak for Data.

```sh
cpdctl ml model-definition list [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--start START] [--limit LIMIT] [--tag-value TAG-VALUE] [--search SEARCH]
```

#### Command options

`--all-pages` (bool)
:   Invoke multiple requests to display all pages of the collection for model-definition-list.

    The default value is `false`.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--limit` (int64)
:   How many resources should be returned. By default limit is 100. Max limit allowed is 200.

    The default value is `0`.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--search` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this search string. The path to the field must be the complete path to the field, and this field must be one of the indexed fields for this resource type. Note that the search string must be URL encoded.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--start` (string)
:   Token required for token-based pagination. This token cannot be determined by end user. It is generated by the service and it is set in the href available in the 'next' field.

`--tag-value` (string)
:   Return only the resources with the given tag values, separated by 'or' or 'and' to support multiple tags.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml model-definition list \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --start exampleString \
    --limit 50 \
    --tag-value 'tf2.0 or tf2.1' \
    --search exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

Retrieve the pipelines for the specified space or project.

```sh
cpdctl ml pipeline list [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--start START] [--limit LIMIT] [--tag-value TAG-VALUE] [--search SEARCH]
```

#### Command options

`--all-pages` (bool)
:   Invoke multiple requests to display all pages of the collection for pipeline-list.

    The default value is `false`.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--limit` (int64)
:   How many resources should be returned. By default limit is 100. Max limit allowed is 200.

    The default value is `0`.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--search` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this search string. The path to the field must be the complete path to the field, and this field must be one of the indexed fields for this resource type. Note that the search string must be URL encoded.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--start` (string)
:   Token required for token-based pagination. This token cannot be determined by end user. It is generated by the service and it is set in the href available in the 'next' field.

`--tag-value` (string)
:   Return only the resources with the given tag values, separated by 'or' or 'and' to support multiple tags.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml pipeline list \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --start exampleString \
    --limit 50 \
    --tag-value 'tf2.0 or tf2.1' \
    --search exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

## • <a name="ml_pipeline_update">`ml pipeline update`</a>


#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--json-patch` ([`JSONPatchOperation[]`](#cli-json-patch-operation-example-schema))
:   Input For Patch. This is the patch body which corresponds to the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) Patch standard (RFC 6902).

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--pipeline` (string)
:   Pipeline name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--pipeline-id'.

`--pipeline-id` (string)
:   Pipeline identifier. This option is mutually exclusive with '--pipeline'.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

##### Example


## • <a name="ml_training_create">`ml training create`</a>
Create a new WML training.

```sh
cpdctl ml training create [command options]
```

#### Command options

`--async` (bool)
:   Run the command asynchronously. By default it waits for the processing to finish.

    The default value is `false`.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the training.

`--experiment` ([`Rel`](#cli-rel-example-schema))
:   A reference to a resource.

`--experiment-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--experiment-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--federated-learning` ([`FederatedLearning`](#cli-federated-learning-example-schema))
:   Federated Learning.

`--federated-learning-byzantine-threshold` (int64)
:   Specifies the failure tolerance, for example the maximum number of parties that would possibly be failing during training.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-crypto` ([`FederatedLearningCrypto`](#cli-federated-learning-crypto-example-schema))
:   Settings for cryptographic fusion for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-epochs` (int64)
:   The total number of passes over the local training dataset to train a model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-fusion-type` (string)
:   The fusion type for federated learning. For an in-depth description of each fusion type, please refer to [here](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/fl-frames.html).
 * 'iter_avg' - Simple Avg, simplest aggregation that is used as a baseline where all parties' model updates are equally weighted.
 * 'avg' - Weighted Avg, weights the average of updates based on the number of each party sample. Use with training data sets of widely differing sizes.
 * 'pfnm' - Probabilistic Federated Neural Matching (PFNM), communication-efficient method for fully connected neural networks when parties have heterogeneous data sets.
 * 'spahm' - K-Means/SPAHM, used to train KMeans (unsupervised learning) models when parties have heterogeneous data sets.
 * 'xgb_classifier' - XGBoost Classification, used to build classification models that use XGBoost.
 * 'xgb_regressor' - XGBoost Regression, used to build regression models that use XGBoost.
 * 'crypto_iter_avg' - Iterative averaging based fusion implemented with a crypto system.

Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'. Allowable values are: iter_avg, avg, pfnm, spahm, xgb_classifier, xgb_regressor, crypto_iter_avg.

`--federated-learning-gamma` (float64)
:   Specifies the expected number of features present in each observation.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-hardware-spec` ([`HardwareSpecRel`](#cli-hardware-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A hardware specification.

`--federated-learning-iters` (int64)
:   Specifies the number of iterations of randomly initialized matching-unmatching procedure is to be performed.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-l2-regularization` (float64)
:   The coefficient for the L2 regularizer.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-learning-rate` (float64)
:   Controls how rapidly to change the model in response to the estimated error each time the model weights are updated.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-log-level` (string)
:   The log level ('critical', 'error', 'warning', 'info', 'debug') for federated learning. Allowable values are: critical, error, warning, info, debug.

`--federated-learning-loss` (string)
:   The loss function to use in the boosting process.

`--federated-learning-max-bins` (int64)
:   The maximum number of bins to use for non-missing values across all features.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-max-depth` (int64)
:   The maximum depth of each tree.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-max-leaf-nodes` (int64)
:   The maximum number of leaves for each tree.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-metrics` (string)
:   The metrics for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-min-samples-leaf` (int64)
:   The minimum number of samples per leaf.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-model` ([`FederatedLearningModel`](#cli-federated-learning-model-example-schema))
:   The model type for federated_learning.

`--federated-learning-num-classes` (int64)
:   Number of target classes for the classification model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-optimizer` ([`FederatedLearningOptimizer`](#cli-federated-learning-optimizer-example-schema))
:   The optimizer for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-random-state` (int64)
:   Seed used to set the pseudo-random number generator.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-remote-training` ([`FederatedLearningRemoteTraining`](#cli-federated-learning-remote-training-example-schema))
:   The remote training for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-rounds` (int64)
:   The number of training iterations to complete between the aggregator and the remote systems unless termination accuracy is achieved first.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-save-intermediate-models` (bool)
:   If true, save the model generated at the end of each round of training.

    The default value is `false`.

`--federated-learning-sigma` (float64)
:   Specifies how far the local model neurons are allowed from the global model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-sigma0` (float64)
:   Specifies the standard deviation of the global network neurons.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-sketch-accuracy-vs-privacy` (float64)
:   Used with XGBoost training to control the relative accuracy of sketched data sent to the aggregator. Higher values will result in higher quality models but with a reduction in data privacy and increase in resource consumption.

Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'. The default value is 0.01. The maximum value is 1. The minimum value is 0.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--federated-learning-termination-predicate` (string)
:   A boolean expression that describes the conditions, in terms of model metrics, under which training should complete.

`--federated-learning-verbose` (bool)
:   A general programming term to produce logging output.

    The default value is `false`.

`--federated-learning-version` (string)
:   The version for federated learning.

`--model-definition` ([`ModelDefinitionRel`](#cli-model-definition-rel-example-schema))
:   A model.
The 'software_spec' is a reference to a software specification.
The 'hardware_spec' is a reference to a hardware specification.

`--model-definition-command` (string)
:   If present, it overrides the command specified to the library resource itself.

`--model-definition-hardware-spec` ([`HardwareSpecRel`](#cli-hardware-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A hardware specification.

`--model-definition-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--model-definition-model-type` (string)
:   The underlying model type produced by the pipeline or by the model_definition.

`--model-definition-parameters` (generic map)
:   Optional key-value pairs parameters.

`--model-definition-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--model-definition-software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the training.

`--pipeline` ([`PipelineRel`](#cli-pipeline-rel-example-schema))
:   A pipeline.
The 'hardware_spec' is a reference to the hardware specification.
The 'hybrid_pipeline_hardware_specs' are used only when training a hybrid pipeline in order to
specify compute requirement for each pipeline node.

`--pipeline-data-bindings` ([`PipelineRelDataBindingsItem[]`](#cli-pipeline-rel-data-bindings-item-example-schema))
:   The data bindings.

`--pipeline-hardware-spec` ([`HardwareSpecRel`](#cli-hardware-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A hardware specification.

`--pipeline-hybrid-pipeline-hardware-specs` ([`HybridPipelineHardwareSpecsItem[]`](#cli-hybrid-pipeline-hardware-specs-item-example-schema))
:   Hybrid pipeline hardware specification.

`--pipeline-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--pipeline-model-type` (string)
:   The underlying model type produced by the pipeline or by the model_definition.

`--pipeline-nodes-parameters` ([`PipelineRelNodesParametersItem[]`](#cli-pipeline-rel-nodes-parameters-item-example-schema))
:   The node parameters.

`--pipeline-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--results-reference` ([`ObjectLocation`](#cli-object-location-example-schema))
:   The training results.

`--results-reference-connection` (generic map)
:   Contains a set of fields specific to each connection. See here for [details about specifying connections](#datareferences).

`--results-reference-id` (string)
:   Item identification inside a collection.

`--results-reference-location` (map[string]string)
:   Contains a set of fields specific to each connection.

`--results-reference-type` (string)
:   The data source type like 'connection_asset' or 'data_asset'. Allowable values are: connection_asset, data_asset, url, fs.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

`--test-data-references` ([`DataConnectionReference[]`](#cli-data-connection-reference-example-schema))
:   The holdout/test datasets.

`--training-data-references` ([`DataConnectionReference[]`](#cli-data-connection-reference-example-schema))
:   Training datasets.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training create \

    --pipeline '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "model_type": "exampleString", "data_bindings": [{"data_reference_name": "exampleString", "node_id": "exampleString"}], "nodes_parameters": [{"node_id": "exampleString", "parameters": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}}], "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}, "hybrid_pipeline_hardware_specs": [{"node_runtime_id": "auto_ai.kb", "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}}]}' \
    --model-definition '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "model_type": "exampleString", "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}, "software_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "..."}, "command": "exampleString", "parameters": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}}' \
    --federated-learning '{"model": {"type": "keras", "spec": {"href": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2"}}, "model_file": "exampleString"}, "fusion_type": "iter_avg", "remote_training": {"quorum": 0.9, "max_timeout": 60, "remote_training_systems": [{"id": "1918939c-2660-4f6a-b727-4b402383dc63", "required": true}]}, "rounds": 3, "termination_predicate": "accuracy > 0.9", "epochs": 3, "optimizer": {"name": "exampleString", "spec": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}}, "loss": "exampleString", "metrics": "exampleString", "max_depth": 38, "learning_rate": 72.5, "l2_regularization": 72.5, "max_bins": 38, "max_leaf_nodes": 38, "min_samples_leaf": 38, "random_state": 38, "verbose": true, "num_classes": 38, "byzantine_threshold": 38, "sigma": 72.5, "sigma0": 72.5, "gamma": 72.5, "iters": 38, "save_intermediate_models": true, "crypto": {"cipher_spec": "encryption_level_1"}, "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}, "software_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "..."}, "version": "exampleString", "log_level": "info", "sketch_accuracy_vs_privacy": 0.01}' \
```

## • <a name="ml_training_get">`ml training get`</a>
Retrieve the training with the specified identifier. This call supports Web-Socket upgrade. However in order to preserve bandwidth, web-socket messages are not context complete. Meaning that a single web-socket message only reflects a message or metric happening in the context of a training job or sub-job (in case of experiment trainings or HPO/AutoML trainings). Hence the metadata property of a web-socket message contains a parent with the href information of the parent job that triggered this particular job. Also the metrics will be provided as they arrive from the backend runtime, and not as a cumulative list. In order to get the full view of the running training job the caller should do a regular GET call.

```sh
cpdctl ml training get --training-id TRAINING-ID [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--training-id` (string)
:   The training identifier.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training get \
    --training-id exampleString \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --version 2019-01-01
```
## • <a name="ml_training_list">`ml training list`</a>
Retrieve the list of trainings for the specified space or project.

```sh
cpdctl ml training list [--start START] [--limit LIMIT] [--total-count=TOTAL-COUNT] [--tag-value TAG-VALUE] [--type TYPE] [--state STATE] [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--parent-id PARENT-ID]
```

#### Command options

`--all-pages` (bool)
:   Invoke multiple requests to display all pages of the collection for training-list.

    The default value is `false`.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--limit` (int64)
:   How many resources should be returned. Default value is 100. Max value is 200.

    The default value is `0`.

`--parent-id` (string)
:   Return the training jobs that are sub-jobs of this parent_id job. The parent_id can be the experiment job ID.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--start` (string)
:   Token required for token-based pagination. This token cannot be determined by end user. It is generated by the service and it is set in the href available in the 'next' field.

`--state` (string)
:   Filter based on on the training job state: queued, running, completed, failed etc.

`--tag-value` (string)
:   Return only the resources with the given tag value.

`--total-count` (bool)
:   Compute the total count. May have performance impact.

    The default value is `false`.

`--type` (string)
:   Filter based on 'pipeline' or 'experiment' trainings. Example: 'type=pipeline'. If not provided, returns all the trainings.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training list \
    --start exampleString \
    --limit 10 \
    --total-count=true \
    --tag-value exampleString \
    --type exampleString \
    --state exampleString \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --parent-id exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

```sh
cpdctl ml training wait --training-id TRAINING_ID [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The ID of the space to use. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--training-id` (string)
:   The training ID.

## • <a name="ml_training-definition_create">`ml training-definition create`</a>
Create a new training definition with the given payload. A training definition represents the training meta-data necessary to start a training job. This command is supported starting with release 3.5 of Cloud Pak for Data.

```sh
cpdctl ml training-definition create [command options]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--custom` (generic map)
:   User defined properties specified as key-value pairs.

`--description` (string)
:   A description of the resource.

`--experiment` ([`Rel`](#cli-rel-example-schema))
:   A reference to a resource.

`--experiment-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--experiment-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--federated-learning` ([`FederatedLearning`](#cli-federated-learning-example-schema))
:   Federated Learning.

`--federated-learning-byzantine-threshold` (int64)
:   Specifies the failure tolerance, for example the maximum number of parties that would possibly be failing during training.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-crypto` ([`FederatedLearningCrypto`](#cli-federated-learning-crypto-example-schema))
:   Settings for cryptographic fusion for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-epochs` (int64)
:   The total number of passes over the local training dataset to train a model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-fusion-type` (string)
:   The fusion type for federated learning. For an in-depth description of each fusion type, please refer to [here](https://dataplatform.cloud.ibm.com/docs/content/wsj/analyze-data/fl-frames.html).
 * 'iter_avg' - Simple Avg, simplest aggregation that is used as a baseline where all parties' model updates are equally weighted.
 * 'avg' - Weighted Avg, weights the average of updates based on the number of each party sample. Use with training data sets of widely differing sizes.
 * 'pfnm' - Probabilistic Federated Neural Matching (PFNM), communication-efficient method for fully connected neural networks when parties have heterogeneous data sets.
 * 'spahm' - K-Means/SPAHM, used to train KMeans (unsupervised learning) models when parties have heterogeneous data sets.
 * 'xgb_classifier' - XGBoost Classification, used to build classification models that use XGBoost.
 * 'xgb_regressor' - XGBoost Regression, used to build regression models that use XGBoost.
 * 'crypto_iter_avg' - Iterative averaging based fusion implemented with a crypto system.

Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'. Allowable values are: iter_avg, avg, pfnm, spahm, xgb_classifier, xgb_regressor, crypto_iter_avg.

`--federated-learning-gamma` (float64)
:   Specifies the expected number of features present in each observation.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-hardware-spec` ([`HardwareSpecRel`](#cli-hardware-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A hardware specification.

`--federated-learning-iters` (int64)
:   Specifies the number of iterations of randomly initialized matching-unmatching procedure is to be performed.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-l2-regularization` (float64)
:   The coefficient for the L2 regularizer.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-learning-rate` (float64)
:   Controls how rapidly to change the model in response to the estimated error each time the model weights are updated.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-log-level` (string)
:   The log level ('critical', 'error', 'warning', 'info', 'debug') for federated learning. Allowable values are: critical, error, warning, info, debug.

`--federated-learning-loss` (string)
:   The loss function to use in the boosting process.

`--federated-learning-max-bins` (int64)
:   The maximum number of bins to use for non-missing values across all features.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-max-depth` (int64)
:   The maximum depth of each tree.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-max-leaf-nodes` (int64)
:   The maximum number of leaves for each tree.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-metrics` (string)
:   The metrics for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-min-samples-leaf` (int64)
:   The minimum number of samples per leaf.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-model` ([`FederatedLearningModel`](#cli-federated-learning-model-example-schema))
:   The model type for federated_learning.

`--federated-learning-num-classes` (int64)
:   Number of target classes for the classification model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-optimizer` ([`FederatedLearningOptimizer`](#cli-federated-learning-optimizer-example-schema))
:   The optimizer for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-random-state` (int64)
:   Seed used to set the pseudo-random number generator.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-remote-training` ([`FederatedLearningRemoteTraining`](#cli-federated-learning-remote-training-example-schema))
:   The remote training for federated learning.

`--federated-learning-rounds` (int64)
:   The number of training iterations to complete between the aggregator and the remote systems unless termination accuracy is achieved first.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-save-intermediate-models` (bool)
:   If true, save the model generated at the end of each round of training.

    The default value is `false`.

`--federated-learning-sigma` (float64)
:   Specifies how far the local model neurons are allowed from the global model.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-sigma0` (float64)
:   Specifies the standard deviation of the global network neurons.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-sketch-accuracy-vs-privacy` (float64)
:   Used with XGBoost training to control the relative accuracy of sketched data sent to the aggregator. Higher values will result in higher quality models but with a reduction in data privacy and increase in resource consumption.

Since CloudPak for Data '4.7.0'. The default value is 0.01. The maximum value is 1. The minimum value is 0.

    The default value is `0`.

`--federated-learning-software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--federated-learning-termination-predicate` (string)
:   A boolean expression that describes the conditions, in terms of model metrics, under which training should complete.

`--federated-learning-verbose` (bool)
:   A general programming term to produce logging output.

    The default value is `false`.

`--federated-learning-version` (string)
:   The version for federated learning.

`--model-definition` ([`ModelDefinitionRel`](#cli-model-definition-rel-example-schema))
:   A model.
The 'software_spec' is a reference to a software specification.
The 'hardware_spec' is a reference to a hardware specification.

`--model-definition-command` (string)
:   If present, it overrides the command specified to the library resource itself.

`--model-definition-hardware-spec` ([`HardwareSpecRel`](#cli-hardware-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A hardware specification.

`--model-definition-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--model-definition-model-type` (string)
:   The underlying model type produced by the pipeline or by the model_definition.

`--model-definition-parameters` (generic map)
:   Optional key-value pairs parameters.

`--model-definition-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--model-definition-software-spec` ([`SoftwareSpecRel`](#cli-software-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A software specification.

`--name` (string)
:   The name of the resource.

`--pipeline` ([`PipelineRel`](#cli-pipeline-rel-example-schema))
:   A pipeline.
The 'hardware_spec' is a reference to the hardware specification.
The 'hybrid_pipeline_hardware_specs' are used only when training a hybrid pipeline in order to
specify compute requirement for each pipeline node.

`--pipeline-data-bindings` ([`PipelineRelDataBindingsItem[]`](#cli-pipeline-rel-data-bindings-item-example-schema))
:   The data bindings.

`--pipeline-hardware-spec` ([`HardwareSpecRel`](#cli-hardware-spec-rel-example-schema))
:   A hardware specification.

`--pipeline-hybrid-pipeline-hardware-specs` ([`HybridPipelineHardwareSpecsItem[]`](#cli-hybrid-pipeline-hardware-specs-item-example-schema))
:   Hybrid pipeline hardware specification.

`--pipeline-id` (string)
:   The id of the referenced resource.

`--pipeline-model-type` (string)
:   The underlying model type produced by the pipeline or by the model_definition.

`--pipeline-nodes-parameters` ([`PipelineRelNodesParametersItem[]`](#cli-pipeline-rel-nodes-parameters-item-example-schema))
:   The node parameters.

`--pipeline-rev` (string)
:   The revision of the referenced resource.

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--results-reference` ([`ObjectLocation`](#cli-object-location-example-schema))
:   The training results.

`--results-reference-connection` (generic map)
:   Contains a set of fields specific to each connection. See here for [details about specifying connections](#datareferences).

`--results-reference-id` (string)
:   Item identification inside a collection.

`--results-reference-location` (map[string]string)
:   Contains a set of fields specific to each connection.

`--results-reference-type` (string)
:   The data source type like 'connection_asset' or 'data_asset'. Allowable values are: connection_asset, data_asset, url, fs.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--tags` (string)
:   A list of tags for this resource.

`--test-data-references` ([`DataConnectionReference[]`](#cli-data-connection-reference-example-schema))
:   The holdout/test datasets.

`--training-data-references` ([`DataConnectionReference[]`](#cli-data-connection-reference-example-schema))
:   Training datasets.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training-definition create \
    --name my-resource \
    --results-reference '{"id": "exampleString", "type": "connection_asset", "connection": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}, "location": {}}' \
    --project-id 12ac4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --space-id 3fc54cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --description 'This is my first resource.' \
    --tags t1,t2 \
    --experiment '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2"}' \
    --pipeline '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "model_type": "exampleString", "data_bindings": [{"data_reference_name": "exampleString", "node_id": "exampleString"}], "nodes_parameters": [{"node_id": "exampleString", "parameters": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}}], "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}, "hybrid_pipeline_hardware_specs": [{"node_runtime_id": "auto_ai.kb", "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}}]}' \
    --model-definition '{"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "model_type": "exampleString", "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}, "software_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "..."}, "command": "exampleString", "parameters": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}}' \
    --federated-learning '{"model": {"type": "keras", "spec": {"href": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2"}}, "model_file": "exampleString"}, "fusion_type": "iter_avg", "remote_training": {"quorum": 0.9, "max_timeout": 60, "remote_training_systems": [{"id": "1918939c-2660-4f6a-b727-4b402383dc63", "required": true}]}, "rounds": 3, "termination_predicate": "accuracy > 0.9", "epochs": 3, "optimizer": {"name": "exampleString", "spec": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}}, "loss": "exampleString", "metrics": "exampleString", "max_depth": 38, "learning_rate": 72.5, "l2_regularization": 72.5, "max_bins": 38, "max_leaf_nodes": 38, "min_samples_leaf": 38, "random_state": 38, "verbose": true, "num_classes": 38, "byzantine_threshold": 38, "sigma": 72.5, "sigma0": 72.5, "gamma": 72.5, "iters": 38, "save_intermediate_models": true, "crypto": {"cipher_spec": "encryption_level_1"}, "hardware_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "exampleString", "num_nodes": 2}, "software_spec": {"id": "4cedab6d-e8e4-4214-b81a-2ddb122db2ab", "rev": "2", "name": "..."}, "version": "exampleString", "log_level": "info", "sketch_accuracy_vs_privacy": 0.01}' \
    --training-data-references '[{"id": "8d3682dd-2858-43c9-bfd7-12a79abcfb0c", "type": "connection_asset", "connection": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}, "location": {}, "schema": {"id": "t1", "name": "Tasks", "fields": [{"anyKey": "anyValue"},{"anotherAnyKey": "anotherAnyValue"}], "type": "struct"}}]' \
    --test-data-references '[{"id": "8d3682dd-2858-43c9-bfd7-12a79abcfb0c", "type": "connection_asset", "connection": {"anyKey": "anyValue"}, "location": {}, "schema": {"id": "t1", "name": "Tasks", "fields": [{"anyKey": "anyValue"},{"anotherAnyKey": "anotherAnyValue"}], "type": "struct"}}]' \
    --custom '{"anyKey": "anyValue"}' \
    --version 2019-01-01
```
## • <a name="ml_training-definition_create-revision">`ml training-definition create-revision`</a>
Create a new training definition revision. The current metadata and content for training_definition_id will be taken and a new revision created. Either `space_id` or `project_id` has to be provided and is mandatory. This command is supported starting with release 3.5 of Cloud Pak for Data.

```sh
cpdctl ml training-definition create-revision --training-definition-id TRAINING-DEFINITION-ID [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--commit-message COMMIT-MESSAGE]
```

#### Command options

`--commit-message` (string)
:   An optional commit message for the revision.

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--training-definition-id` (string)
:   Training definition identifier.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training-definition create-revision \
    --training-definition-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --space-id 3fc54cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 12ac4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --commit-message exampleString \
    --version 2019-01-01
```

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

```sh
cpdctl ml training-definition get --training-definition-id TRAINING-DEFINITION-ID [{--space-id SPACE-ID | --space SPACE-NAME}] [{--project-id PROJECT-ID | --project PROJECT-NAME}] [--rev REV]
```

#### Command options

`--cpd-scope` (string)
:   CPD space or project scope, e.g. 'cpd://default-profile/spaces/7bccdda4-9752-4f37-868e-891de6c48135'

`--project` (string)
:   Project name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project-id'.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--rev` (string)
:   The revision number of the resource.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--training-definition-id` (string)
:   Training definition identifier.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training-definition get \
    --training-definition-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
```

## • <a name="ml_training-definition_list">`ml training-definition list`</a>

```sh

```

#### Command options

`--all-pages` (bool)

    The default value is `false`.

:   How many resources should be returned. By default limit is 100. Max limit allowed is 200.

`--project-id` (string)
:   The project that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--project'.

`--search` (string)
:   Returns only resources that match this search string. The path to the field must be the complete path to the field, and this field must be one of the indexed fields for this resource type. Note that the search string must be URL encoded.

`--space` (string)
:   Deployment space name. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space-id'.

`--space-id` (string)
:   The space that contains the resource. Either 'space_id' or 'project_id' query parameter has to be given. This option is mutually exclusive with '--space'.

`--start` (string)
:   Token required for token-based pagination. This token cannot be determined by end user. It is generated by the service and it is set in the href available in the 'next' field.

`--tag-value` (string)
:   Return only the resources with the given tag values, separated by 'or' or 'and' to support multiple tags.

##### Example

```sh
   cpdctl ml training-definition list \
    --space-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \
    --project-id 63dc4cf1-252f-424b-b52d-5cdd9814987f \

    --limit 50 \
    --tag-value 'tf2.0 or tf2.1' \

    --version 2019-01-01
```
